alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 06 at 2:44PM MST until December 08 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations above 3000 feet 3 to 7 inches. * WHERE...Lookout Pass, Dobson Pass, and Mullan. Also portions of the St Joe Mountains. * WHEN...From 2 AM Thursday to 10 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of half an inch of snow per hour are possible (20-30% chance) during Thursday morning and evening commute times. Temperatures will continue to cool overnight into early Friday morning resulting in winter driving conditions Friday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1.
